results.title: Round the twist: spaghetti pig out
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Paul Jennings
results.brief_description: Chaos reigns after a bolt of lightning hits the video remote control - it works on people! Pause, rewind and fast-forward have amusing consequences, particularly at the spaghetti eating competition.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children’s Television Foundation and Paul Jennings

results.title: Round the twist: a good tip for ghosts
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Paul Jennings
results.brief_description: To pass a nerve test, Pete has to collect a rotting skull from the pond at the tip in the middle of the night. But he encounters the resident ghost who wants something from him.

results.title: Round the twist: skeleton on the dunny
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When the Twists move from the city to live in an old lighthouse, they discover that the outside dunny is haunted. One stormy night they decide to have a showdown with a very flushed ghost.

results.title: Round the twist: the cabbage patch fib
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Paul Jennings
results.brief_description: Believing that babies grow in the cabbage patch, Bronson actually finds one there. But he soon discovers that the responsibilities of parenthood have their drawbacks.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

results.title: Round the twist: birdsdo
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Paul Jennings
results.brief_description: Nell is committed to hospital for believing in dragons; so Linda, Pete and Bronson set off to prove her sanity. While rogue seagulls imprison Linda and Pete in a shack buried in bird droppings, Bronson finds the dragon’s egg and Nell is released.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children’s Television Foundation and Paul Jennings

results.title: Particles in Space
results.brief_description: 1. New kinds of scratch imagery reflect the disparate element of the title as dots and dashes squiggle about the screen. Supported by a grant from the National Endowment for the Arts. (A Federal Agency, Washington DC)
results.description: 1. New kinds of scratch imagery reflect the disparate element of the title as dots and dashes squiggle about the screen. Supported by a grant from the National Endowment for the Arts. (A Federal Agency, Washington DC)

holdings.name: MOV file H264; ACMI Digital Access Copy - presentation

results.title: Tal Farlow
results.brief_description: Jazz guitarist Tal Farlow provides the background music to Lye’s final film, which, although begun in the 1950s, was not recommenced until the 1980s. Unfortunately he died before completing it. It contains vertical white scratches as well as geometric white scratches on black. It was completed by Lye’s assistant Steve Jones under the supervision of Ann Lye. Supported in part by a grant from the Queen Elizabeth II Arts Council of New Zealand.
results.description: Jazz guitarist Tal Farlow provides the background music to Lye’s final film, which, although begun in the 1950s, was not recommenced until the 1980s. Unfortunately he died before completing it. It contains vertical white scratches as well as geometric white scratches on black. It was completed by Lye’s assistant Steve Jones under the supervision of Ann Lye. Supported in part by a grant from the Queen Elizabeth II Arts Council of New Zealand.

holdings.name: MOV file H264; ACMI Digital Access Copy - presentation

results.title: Free radicals
results.brief_description:
A primitive kinetic dance of white lines and angles meticulously scratched onto black and white film over an 8 month period and then edited and retrospectively matched with an African field tape of the Bagirmi tribe. The title is a reference to modern physics, ‘free radicals’ being particles of energy. The original version was a major award winner at the Experimental Film Competition at the 1958 Brussels World Fair. This revised version was a reworking of the
original by Lye in 1979, with financial assistance from
the New Zealand Film Commission. He deleted approximately 1 min. from his first version, made in 1958.

results.title: Holeproof Antz Pantz [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
A commercial for Holeproof Antz Pantz featuring an echidna called Rex. The ad caused some heated debate when first aired. in the late 1980s.
Produced by Campaign Palace.
